caller_intent: Christopher Minor wants to understand if increasing his deductible from $500 to $1,000 would lower his monthly insurance payments and is concerned about recent billing discrepancies, including a reinstatement fee and unexpected payment increases.
resolution_steps: Agent confirmed Christopher's policy details (2015 Chevy Cruze, $500 deductible).
Agent calculated the impact of raising the deductible to $1,000, noting a $47 monthly reduction (from $392 to $345).
Agent reviewed billing history, identifying two payments due on the same day and a prior reinstatement fee.
Agent decided to contact National General to investigate the billing anomalies and resolve the payment discrepancies.
knowledge_required: Understanding of insurance deductibles and their impact on premiums
Billing process for auto insurance policies
Carrier-specific reinstatement fees and payment structures
summary: Christopher Minor sought to reduce his monthly insurance payments by increasing his deductible but found the savings minimal. The agent identified billing irregularities, including duplicate payments and a reinstatement fee, and committed to contacting the carrier for resolution. The call concluded with a promise to follow up after investigating the billing discrepancies.
